newsitem.title: USA: Digital cuts prices for Pentium-based PCs.
newsitem.headline: Digital cuts prices for Pentium-based PCs.

text.p: Digital Equipment Corp said Friday it had reduced prices by up to 19 percent for Pentium- and Pentium Pro-based models throughout its Venturis and Celebris personal computer lines.
The company said estimated U.S. street prices would start at $977 for entry-level Venturis models, and $2,078 for the Celebris GL models.
It said the price cuts place its desktops below those made by Compaq Computer Corp and Hewlett-Packard Co.
The price cuts are effective only in the United States, it said.
"Digital is taking this pricing action in line with our goal to establish leadership in the NT (new technology) client marketplace," it said.
Intel Corp makes the Pentium chip.
